definition: to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]

sentences.english: The robberies have chilled the mah-jongg network.
sentences.chinese: 搶劫案已經使麻將賭博網絡膽戰心驚。

sentences.english: The robber grabbed the mobile phone away from the woman.
sentences.chinese: 搶劫犯把那名婦女的手機搶走了。

sentences.english: The man was caught red-handed in robbery.
sentences.chinese: 那個人在搶劫時被當場抓住。

sentences.english: She refused to hand over her purse to a man who was trying to mug her.
sentences.chinese: 她拒絕將她的包交給正試圖向她搶劫的那男人。

sentences.english: Tom howled  the news that some masked men held up a bank.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆喊叫着說，有幾個蒙面人搶劫了銀行。

sentences.english: It is a very simple case of robbery.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個很簡單的搶劫案件。

sentences.english: The robber was captured and disarmed.
sentences.chinese: 那個搶劫犯被抓住了，並被繳了械。

sentences.english: The looting appeared to be dissipating as police vans were stationed at damage sites.
sentences.chinese: 搶劫行動看起來被駐紮在受損地點的警車驅散。

sentences.english: The criminal who looted the bank has been hounded down.
sentences.chinese: 搶劫銀行的那名罪犯已被捉拿歸案了。

sentences.english: They had carried out their robbery with swords, blades and pistols.
sentences.chinese: 他們已經履行了其與劍，刀和手槍搶劫。

sentences.english: The robbers delivered all of the passengers on board of their money.
sentences.chinese: 搶劫者劫取車上所有乘客的錢。

sentences.english: Maybe they want to rob her, we should follow them.
sentences.chinese: 可能是想搶劫，我們跟上去看看吧。

sentences.english: The rubber gaudio-videoe himself up to the police after two weeks on the run.
sentences.chinese: 那個搶劫犯在押竄了兩個星期後向警方自首了。

sentences.english: Armed robbery and abduction have been on the increase countrywide.
sentences.chinese: 持械搶劫和誘拐案的案發率在全國範圍內都有所上升。

sentences.english: I wish they would leave us alone and go and arrest some muggers instead.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他們別管我們，去逮捕那些行兇搶劫者。

sentences.english: Three hours later, stores are looted and the car behind you is on fire.
sentences.chinese: 三小時後就出現了被搶劫的商店和被焚燬的汽車。

definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to set on fire/to commit arson
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
